statement:
Let $p$ and $q$ be two distinct odd primes. Then:

$$\left(\frac{q}{p}\right)\left(\frac{p}{q}\right)=(-1)^{(p-1)(q-1)/4}$$

where $\left(\frac{\cdot}{\cdot}\right)$ is the symbol (or Legendre
symbol).

The following is an equivalent formulation of the Law of Quadratic
Reciprocity:

Let $p,q$ be distinct odd primes. Then:

1.  $\displaystyle \left(\frac{p}{q}\right) = \left(\frac{q}{p}\right)$
    if one of $p$ or $q$ is congruent to $1$ modulo $4$;

2.  $\displaystyle \left(\frac{p}{q}\right) = - \left(\frac{q}{p}\right)$
    if both $p$ and $q$ are congruent to $3$ modulo $4$.
